security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown and TypeScript code examples. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no external commands, no environment variable access. This is a safe reference skill for Expo React Native native feature patterns.

content.user_title: Implement native Expo React Native features
content.value_statement: React Native apps need native device capabilities for camera, notifications, and sensors. This skill provides ready-to-use code patterns for implementing these features in Expo applications.
actual_capabilities: Request and check native permissions with proper user guidance
Implement camera capture and image picker with permission handling
Set up push notifications with Expo push token registration
Add haptic feedback for user interface interactions
Access device location with foreground and background tracking
Store data securely using SecureStore and AsyncStorage
limitations: Focuses on Expo managed workflow patterns only
Does not include native module development outside Expo
Examples are reference patterns, not complete implementations
Does not cover bare React Native CLI workflow

best_practices: Always request permissions before accessing native features and handle denial gracefully
Test native features on physical devices since simulators lack camera, haptics, and push notifications
Use SecureStore only for small sensitive data like tokens, not large objects
anti_patterns: Do not assume permissions are granted; always check status before using native APIs
Do not store sensitive data in AsyncStorage; it is not encrypted
Do not ignore permission denial; provide clear guidance to users

faq.question: Does this work on Android?
faq.answer: Most patterns work on Android. Some features like haptics behave differently or have platform-specific APIs.

faq.question: What are the size limits for SecureStore?
faq.answer: SecureStore has a limit of approximately 2KB per item. Use it for tokens and small credentials only.

faq.question: Can I use these patterns in bare React Native?
faq.answer: These patterns are for Expo managed workflow. Bare React Native requires different native module setup.

faq.question: Is my data safe in AsyncStorage?
faq.answer: AsyncStorage is not encrypted. Use it only for non-sensitive data like user preferences.

faq.question: Why are notifications not working on simulator?
faq.answer: Push notifications require a physical device. Use local notifications for simulator testing.

faq.question: How is this different from react-native-camera?
faq.answer: This skill uses Expo modules which work in Expo EAS Build. react-native-camera requires native module linking.
